text: hey everybody and welcome to my shop
this week and working on a project that
I wanted to build for the past seven
years probably I want to build a mobile
sound system on a bicycle I haven't done
it so far because I know nothing about
audio and it's actually something I
wanted to work really well so I needed a
good collaboration partner this guy is
an expert in car HiFi audio everything
that has to do with sound but the
problem is he's very very busy now
thanks to job box who are the sponsor of
this video we could collaborate without
being in the shop together let's get
started by picking the bike and then
seeing how much audio we can pack on it
this is the perfect bike for my project
the only problem is the saddle it is in
the way but I think I might have an idea

all right so this is the finished boom
bike and I am so happy with this I
didn't expect it to come out that nice
basically in the back we have all our
speakers and a giant subwoofer we
secured everything with these military
ratchet straps so it's pretty solid and
then I made this little roof that you
can also take down look go to the other
side this is the roof that you can also
take down what and then it says food
bike since the driver doesn't have the
speaker's there in the back which is a
good thing because this thing is so loud
you could you could probably not drive
it with the stereo at full blast but we
added a little monitor speakers so when
you're driving you still know what's
going on and inside we hit most of the
technical stuff because once it's set up
you don't need it anymore but this is
the heart of the whole project
that's this go zero power bank and then
we have a little mixer that we can
attach various devices to and that's all
we need to that's all we ever need to
change in case you're wondering how long
this battery will last we actually don't
know but we have been shooting all day
and it has this display where it tells
you approximately how much long I will
go we had this run all day and it's
still up to almost 30 hours we started
with 40 hours this is a solar battery so
you can just bring your solar panel and
recharge it so it's pretty much
unlimited loudness okay now let's see
how long we can go this is not loud at
all
